snippet: More than 100 migrants were rescued in rough seas, but the others perished before the Italian Coast Guard could get them to shore, officials said.
abstract: Italian Coast Guard ship rescues more than 100 migrants in rough seas off Libyan coast, but 29 die from exhaustion and exposure before reaching shore; migrants are among tens of thousands who pay smugglers to cross the Mediterranean in hope of finding a better life in the West.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and JIM YARDLEY

lead_paragraph: More than 100 migrants were rescued in rough seas, but the others perished before the Italian Coast Guard could get them to shore, officials said.

headline.main: Migrants Are Plucked From Sea Off Libya, but 29 Die Aboard Italian Rescue Ships
headline.print_headline: Migrants Are Plucked From Sea Off Libya, but 29 Die Aboard Italian Rescue Ships
